enum.name: SkillStatusEnum
enum.comment: This determines the current status of skill execution.
enum.item: The skill string has been successfully processed.
The execution failed and cannot succeed anymore.

data.comment: The interface provides access to the skill execution runtime plugin. It provides basic status information about skiller and allows for calling skills via messages. It can also be used to manually restart the Lua interpreter if something is wedged.
data.field: Combined string showing as much as possible of the currently executed skills string, at most the first 1023 bytes of it. Must be properly null-terminated. Shall be of the following format: S skill1(param) || S skill2() [||...] where S is one of F, R, X (marking the skill state, where X is failure) and skill1(param) etc. are the skills of the respective sandboxes. || is used to separate the strings (representing concurrent execution). Inactive channels shall be omitted.

String describing the error. Can be set by a skill when it fails. Shall be of the form: N string | N string... where N denotes the skill channel and string the respective error string. Active channels which did not post an error message shall be omitted.

Instance serial of the exclusive controller of the skiller. If this does not carry your instance serial your exec messages will be ignored. Aquire control with the AquireControlMessage. Make sure you release control before exiting.
The status of the current skill execution for the appropriate channel.

message.name: ExecSkill
message.comment: Sets the skill string and orders execution of this skill string.

message.name: StopExec
message.comment: Stops the execution of a skill.

message.name: StopAll
message.comment: Stops the execution of all skills.

message.name: AcquireControl
message.comment: Aquires exclusive control over the skiller. The used ID is the instance serial of the interface where this message was enqueued.
